Recipe.title: Easy Potatoes Au Gratin
Recipe.Description:
In Utah, just about everybody has a variation of this recipe. We once had a Stake cookbook that had about 10 versions.
Of course, it has lots of names too: Cheesy Potatoes, Cheesy Hash, Funeral Potatoes (Because it was a standard dish people brought for the family at the after funeral meal.). I like the name used here because it lends at least some respect to the dish.

section.instruction: Peel potatoes and coarsely shred them.
Mix Shredded Potatoes, Soup, Sour Cream, Grated Cheese, Green Onion, Salt and Pepper.
Press into a 9&inch; &by; 9&inch; pan and cover with foil.
Place in oven at 400° for 45 minutes.

While it is baking:
Crush Crackers into crumbs.
Melt butter.
When time is up, remove pan from oven and remove foil.
Mix Crackers and Butter, then spread mixture evenly over top of Potatoes.
Replace in oven and cook for an additional 10 minutes.

Notes.note: A cheese grater is ideal for "coarsely shredding" the Potatoes.
It doesn't have to be "Ritz" Crackers, but Saltines do not taste very good. In general, stick to round Crackers that come in 3-4 tubes to a box.
Do not mix the Crackers and Butter until just before you spread it over potatoes. Otherwise you will end up with a paste instead of a crumbly topping.

Modifications.modification: Use Corn Flakes (with or without butter) instead of Crackers. (Not my favorite.)
Use Cheddar Cheese instead of Cheddar-Jack Cheese. (Good, but less tangy.)
Use regular Onions instead of Green Onions. (Changes the taste significantly, but it is still good).

Instead of shredding the Potatoes, slice them thinly, or cut them into ¼&inch;-½&inch; cubes.
(Add 10 minutes cooking time for cubes.)
Instead of fresh Potatoes, use frozen Hash Brown Potatoes. (Changes consistency, but it's really easy.)
